and play diverse roles

3196.64.text: "in the church and in the wider society.

3199.62.text:
"It is our desire that Jesuits
along with our colleagues

3205.36.text: "a consistent message of respect for life

3213.56.text:
"All of them, particularly
the most vulnerable

3215.42.text:
"and those yet to be born,
must be treated with respect

3219.66.text: "and protected by the laws of our nation.

3226.67.text:
Living God, we thank you for
the blessing of our gathering

3229.09.text:
for all of our organizers and
presenters and participants

3232.49.text:
who have given of their
talent, their thought,

3238.60.text:
You gather us here so that we
can deepen our understanding,

3241.88.text: our prayer, our conviction to promote life

3244.90.text:
from the moment of
conception to natural death.

3248.76.text:
Dear Lord life is indeed
your sacred gift to us all.

3252.09.text: You have given us this day for us to live.

3255.33.text: But life is also our noble commission.

3258.44.text:
That is, we must use our lives
to promote respect for life

3261.56.text: in all ways, from unborn children

3264.30.text:
to those in our society who
are looked over or left behind.

3268.66.text:
Those who live in the shadows,
those infirmed and dying.

3273.22.text:
Help us dear Lord to
be worthy of that call

3276.70.text:
for your glory is the
human person fully alive.

3282.19.text: Dear Lord we commend all of our thinking

3284.53.text:
and learning, our work
and efforts this day

3287.45.text:
to your hands knowing
that with your grace,

3289.44.text: all will be brought to fruition

3292.07.text: for your glory and the good of all.

3294.23.text: We ask this through Christ our lord, amen.
